div.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border: 0px; font-stretch: inherit; line-height: inherit; vertical-align: baseline; color: rgb(33, 33, 33);
color: rgb(33, 33, 33); margin: 0px; padding: 0px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-stretch: inherit; border: 0px;

p.span: Regional School District No. 6 is located in the rural northwest corner of Connecticut and is comprised of the towns of Warren, Morris, and Goshen. The District consists of three elementary schools, each inclusive of grades pre-kindergarten through grade 6, and one high school housing grades 7 through 12. Children from seven additional towns may apply to our national award-winning Agricultural Science program, which is available for students in grades 9-12.
